hero.title: AI in Development
hero.subtitle: How to use artificial intelligence wisely
hero.description: Tools, prompts, and best practices for developers who want to be more productive with AI—without losing the essence of knowing how to program.
hero.warning: Important: AI is a powerful tool, but developers should always focus on learning and solving problems on their own before using AI. Do not rely exclusively on it.

v0.title: v0 by Vercel
v0.subtitle: Prototyping and UI with AI
v0.description: v0 is ideal for generating layouts, components, and entire pages with shadcn/ui and Tailwind. Perfect for speeding up interface creation without compromising quality.

features.title: UI generation
features.description: Describe what you want and receive ready-made React components with Tailwind and shadcn.

features.title: Quick iteration
features.description: Refine the result by chatting -- adjust colors, layout, responsiveness in seconds.

features.title: Clean code
features.description: The output follows best practices for Next.js with App Router, Server Components, and more.

features.title: Real components
features.description: Use real shadcn/ui, without magical abstractions. You have complete control over the code.

v0.promptContent: Create a modern landing page for a SaaS project management app. Use a dark theme, hero with CTA, 3-column grid feature section, testimonials, and pricing with 3 plans. Use shadcn/ui and Framer Motion for animations.

copilot.title: GitHub Co-pilot
copilot.subtitle: Real-time code assistant
copilot.description: Copilot works directly in the editor, suggesting code as you type. It's great for boilerplate, tests, and repetitive patterns—but you need to know how to validate what it suggests.

features.title: Smart autocomplete
features.description: Suggests entire functions based on the context of the file and project.

features.title: Test generation
features.description: Write the name of the test and it completes with real scenarios based on its function.

features.title: Inline documentation
features.description: Generates JSDoc, comments, and code explanations automatically.

features.title: Multi-language
features.description: Works with TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, and dozens of other languages.

mindset.title: Right Mindset
mindset.subtitle: AI and tools, not crutches
mindset.description: The biggest mistake a developer can make is to rely on AI without understanding what is being generated. Use AI to accelerate, not to replace your knowledge.

principles.title: Learn first, automate later
principles.description: Before asking AI to solve it, try it yourself. Understand the problem, research the solution, and only then use AI to speed up implementation.

principles.title: Always review the output
principles.description: AI-generated code may contain subtle bugs, security vulnerabilities, or outdated patterns. Review each line as if you had written it yourself.

principles.title: Use it to learn, not to copy
principles.description: Ask for explanations along with the code. Ask "why this approach?" instead of just copying and pasting.

principles.title: Context and everything
principles.description: The more context you provide (stack, constraints, project patterns), the better the result will be. Vague prompts generate vague code.

principles.title: AI does not replace experience
principles.description: Knowing what to ask, when to be suspicious of the output, and how to integrate correctly requires real development experience.

cta.title: Would you like to exchange ideas?
cta.description: If you enjoyed these tips, let's talk about how to apply AI to your development workflow.
